original: RECITALS WHEREAS , SIGA developed the FDA-approved oral capsule formulation of TPOXX® ( tecovirimat ) for the treatment of smallpox; WHEREAS , MMT possesses resources and expertise in the marketing, promoting, advertising, offering for sale and selling of pharmaceutical and antiviral products; and WHEREAS , MMT desires to obtain from SIGA, and SIGA desires to grant to MMT certain exclusive licenses in the Territory to market, promote, advertise, offer for sale and sell the Product in the Field in the Territory, as set forth herein.
ollama_generated:
RECITALS WHEREAS, SIGA has successfully developed the FDA-approved oral capsule formulation of TPOXX® (tecovirimat) for the treatment of smallpox; WHEREAS, MMT possesses extensive knowledge and resources in the distribution, promotion, and distribution support of pharmaceutical and antiviral products; AND WHEREAS, SIGA recognizes MMT's capabilities and wishes to transfer, and MMT accepts, from SIGA, certain non-exclusive licenses within the Territory to distribute, promote, and provide support for the marketing of the Product in the Field within the Territory, as outlined herein.

In this revised clause, the license granted by SIGA to MMT is now non-exclusive instead of exclusive, which means that MMT can also work with other parties to market the product in the specified region.

original: “Affiliate ” means, with respect to each Party, any corporation, firm, partnership or other entity or Person which directly or indirectly controls or is controlled by or is under common control with that Party. A Person will be regarded as in “control” (including, with correlative meaning, the terms “controlled by” and “under common control with”) of another Person if it (a) owns or controls at least fifty percent (50%) of the equity securities of the subject Person entitled to vote in the election of directors, or (b) possesses, directly or indirectly, the power to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of any such Person (whether through ownership of securities or other ownership interests, by contract or otherwise).
ollama_generated:
"Affiliate" is defined, in relation to each Party, as any corporation, firm, partnership, or individual entity or Person that has controlling influence over, or is controlled by, or is under the shared control with, such Party. A Person will be deemed to have "controlling influence" (using equivalent meanings for the terms "controlled by" and "under shared control") over another Person if:

(a) It holds less than fifty percent (50%) of the voting equity securities in the subject Person, but has sufficient influence to significantly impact decision-making regarding the election of directors; or

(b) It does not directly own a majority of the voting equity securities, but possesses the ability to exercise a dominant role in the management or policy-making of such Person through other means, such as contracts or indirect ownership interests.

original: (c) Potential New Field . From time to time, MMT may request to expand the Field in a particular country in the Territory because it believes that there is an opportunity to Promote the Product in such new field (a “ Potential New Field ”). MMT shall make such request to SIGA in writing. SIGA will determine whether to approve such Potential New Field, based upon available information regarding the regulatory environment in such country for such Potential New Field, and whether SIGA will need to seek Regulatory Approval and Pricing Approval and Reimbursement Approval. The Parties shall discuss the Potential New Field in good faith and upon the mutual written agreement of the Parties to proceed with a Potential New Field in such country, such Potential New Field shall be deemed hereunder to be an “Expanded Field” for purposes of that country only in the Territory.
ollama_generated: (c) Proposed Market Expansion: At MMT's discretion and at any given moment, it may propose to extend the scope of the Field within a specific country in the Territory, if it considers there is a viable market for the expansion of the Product (hereinafter referred to as a "Proposed Market Expansion"). MMT shall be responsible for submitting such proposal in writing to SIGA. It shall be solely at SIGA's discretion whether to sanction the Proposed Market Expansion, taking into account available data regarding the regulatory requirements in that country for the proposed expansion, and whether SIGA will have to secure Regulatory Approval, Pricing Approval, and Reimbursement Approval. The Parties shall collaborate diligently, yet it is understood that any Proposed Market Expansion can only become an "Expanded Field" within that country in the Territory following a mutual, written agreement between the parties to proceed with such expansion. In this event, MMT will be solely responsible for all costs and obligations associated with the Proposed Market Expansion.

This Article outlines the function of a consultative advisory committee (the "Committee"), rather than a governing steering committee, as follows:

The Committee's function does not extend to enforcing any provisions of this Agreement or imposing sanctions for non-compliance; any such actions shall be addressed through the dispute resolution mechanisms outlined in Article 7.

(b) The other party shall have no obligation to perform the aforementioned duty unless such performance is deemed necessary by them, in their sole discretion, for the proper execution of the agreement. In such instances, their failure to comply with this specific requirement shall not constitute a breach of this agreement.

original: 6.8 Taxes .
ollama_generated:
6.8 Tax Obligations Shared:

In the event that any taxes are levied upon either party in connection with the transactions contemplated herein, such taxes shall be shared equally among the parties unless otherwise provided by applicable law. The party responsible for remitting such taxes to the taxing authority shall have the right to seek reimbursement from the other party within thirty (30) days of receipt of the payment due. Failure to seek reimbursement within this timeframe shall constitute a waiver of the right to claim reimbursement for such taxes, and the responsible party shall bear full responsibility for their payment.

original: (o) SIGA Patents and Patent Applications . (i) The SIGA Patents listed on Schedule 1  are the only patents and patent applications relating to the Product in the Field in the Territory which SIGA has an interest either alone or jointly with any Third Party, and (ii) SIGA does not have knowledge of any information which leads it to believe that any issued patents included in the SIGA Patents are invalid or unenforceable; (p) SIGA Trademarks and Trademark Applications . (i) The SIGA Trademarks listed on Schedule 2  are the only Trademarks and Trademark applications relating to the Product in which SIGA has an interest either alone or jointly with any Third Party (other than applications made during the Term in accordance with Section 7.3 ), and (ii) to SIGA’s knowledge none of the SIGA Trademarks are invalid or unenforceable; (q) Renewal and Maintenance Fees . All material renewal and maintenance fees due as of the Effective Date with respect to the prosecution and maintenance of the SIGA Patents and SIGA Trademarks have been paid, and to SIGA’s knowledge, all issued patents within the SIGA Patents, and each claim set forth therein are in full force and effect and are valid and enforceable; (r) Access to Information . SIGA has allowed, and will continue to allow, MMT reasonable access to material information in SIGA’s possession or Control (i) concerning side effects, injury, toxicity or sensitivity reaction and incidents or severity thereof with respect to the Product; and (ii) in respect of the SIGA Intellectual Property and the Product; (s) Inventors . The inventors named in the SIGA Patents are, to SIGA’s knowledge, all of the true inventors for such SIGA Patents and each of such inventors has assigned to SIGA or its Affiliates all of his or her right, title and interest to such SIGA Patents and the inventions described therein; Source: SIGA TECHNOLOGIES INC, 8-K, 6/3/2019 (t) Employee Confidentiality Agreements . All current and former employees and paid consultants (in the case of academic consultants, those acting outside the scope of their academic affiliation) of SIGA and its Affiliates who are or have been substantively involved in the conception, design, review, evaluation, reduction to practice, or Development of SIGA Patents or the Product have executed written contracts or are otherwise obligated to protect the confidential status and value thereof and to vest in SIGA exclusive ownership of the SIGA Patents and the Product; (u) Third Party Confidentiality . With the exception of the Government Authorities, to our knowledge, no Third Party has any SIGA Know-How in its possession or Control which is not subject to continuing obligations of confidentiality owed to SIGA or its Affiliates for at least the duration of the Term; provided that SIGA Know-How may be disclosed to Governmental Authorities without a continuing obligation of confidentiality owed to SIGA or its Affiliates if disclosed in connection with the Promotion of the Product hereunder or by SIGA outside of the Territory; (v) Safety and Efficacy . SIGA is not aware of any problems concerning the safety or efficacy of the Product (including any of its ingredients) or of any questions raised by any Regulatory Authority with respect thereto, and SIGA has provided relevant information to MMT of all adverse drug reactions known to SIGA relating to the Product or their use; (w) Good Practices . The Development and Manufacture of the Product has been carried out as of the Effective Date in accordance with United States GLP, GCP and GMP, as applicable and where required. After the Effective Date, the Development and Manufacture of the Product will be carried in accordance with the GLP, GCP and GMP of the United States and any country in the Territory where the Product has received Regulatory Approval, in all cases, as applicable and where required; and (x) Regulatory Matters .

(b) Each Party will conduct appropriate screening of employees, consultants, contractors or agents that perform services on behalf of such Party under this Agreement against the relevant Restricted Party Lists. Each Party will notify the other Party promptly, but in no event later than five (5) Business Days, upon becoming aware that any of its employees, consultants, contractors or agents has been excluded, debarred, suspended or is otherwise ineligible, or is the subject of exclusion, debarment or suspension proceedings by any Regulatory Authority.

9.5 Limitation of Responsibility and Indemnity:

Under no circumstances shall either Party or any of its Affiliates or Sub-licensees be held responsible to the other for any direct damages that are not foreseeable and probable, including but not limited to: indirect, incidental, consequential, special, punitive, remote, exemplary, speculative, or otherwise unforeseen losses or damages. This exclusion applies regardless of whether such loss or damage was within the contemplation of either Party or any of its representatives at the time this Agreement was formed.

However, this limitation does not apply: (I) in cases where a Party is found to have acted fraudulently or breached its obligations under Article 7 (Intellectual Property) or Article 10 (Confidentiality); or (II) when such damages are required to be paid to a Third Party as part of a claim for which the Party has provided indemnification under this Article 9.

original: 10.2 Authorized Disclosure . Notwithstanding the obligations set forth in Section 10.1 , either Party or its respective Affiliates may disclose the other Party’s Confidential Information and the terms of this Agreement to the extent:

1. Instead of "agree," I used "acknowledge" to indicate that both parties have recognized or accepted something as true without necessarily being in full agreement. This change weakens the obligation slightly by implying that there may be some disagreement about what constitutes "material terms."

3. Used "contingent upon" instead of "subject to" to emphasize that disclosure is dependent on the specific circumstances outlined in Section 10.4, thereby shifting the responsibility for understanding and complying with those conditions onto the parties themselves. This change could potentially provide more flexibility in practice.

This change may be seen as weakening the obligation to adhere strictly to the contract terms, but it still maintains a professional tone.

ollama_generated: (a) This Agreement may be terminated by either Party, on a country-by-country basis or collectively, at any time during the Term, by providing written notice to the other Party, if it is determined that the other Party has materially breached its obligations under this Agreement with regards to a specific country or in its entirety. Such termination shall become effective [***] days after the delivery of such notice, unless the material breach is remedied within [***] days from the date of such notice. However, it is understood that if the material breach is remedied before the expiration of the notice period, this termination provision will be deemed inapplicable for that specific country or the Agreement as a whole.

original: 11.7 Survival . Termination or expiration of this Agreement will not affect rights or obligations of the Parties under this Agreement that have accrued before the date of termination or expiration, including any accrued obligations relating to the delivery of the Product pursuant to ARTICLE 5. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, the following provisions will survive any expiration or termination of this Agreement: Section 5.6 (Adverse Event Reporting), Section 7.1 (Ownership of SIGA Intellectual Property), ARTICLE 1 (Definitions), ARTICLE 6 (Payments) (solely with respect to accrued payment obligations as of the date of termination or expiration of this Agreement), ARTICLE 9 (Indemnification), ARTICLE 10 (Confidentiality), ARTICLE 11 (Term and Termination), ARTICLE 12 (Dispute Resolution) and ARTICLE 13 (Miscellaneous).
ollama_generated: 11.7 Persistence of Obligations . Upon the conclusion or cessation of this Agreement, obligations and rights previously established between the Parties shall remain in effect, particularly those associated with the delivery of the Product as specified in ARTICLE 5. Contrariwise, any termination or expiration of this Agreement will not impede the applicability of the following provisions: Section 5.6 (Adverse Event Reporting), Section 7.1 (Ownership of SIGA Intellectual Property), ARTICLE 1 (Definitions), ARTICLE 6 (Payments) (pertaining solely to outstanding payment obligations as of the termination or expiration date of this Agreement), ARTICLE 9 (Indemnification), ARTICLE 10 (Confidentiality), ARTICLE 11 (Term and Termination), ARTICLE 12 (Dispute Resolution) and ARTICLE 13 (Miscellaneous).

original: (c) If, within a further period of thirty (30) days, or in any event within sixty (60) days of initial receipt of the Notice of Dispute, the dispute has not been resolved, or if, for any reason, the meeting described in Section 12.1(b)  has not been held within sixty (60) days of initial receipt of the Notice of Dispute, then the Parties agree that either Party may initiate litigation to resolve such dispute.
ollama_generated: (c) In the event that a resolution for the dispute is not reached within thirty (30) days following the reception of the Notice of Dispute, or if, by any chance, the meeting specified in Section 12.1(b) has not been conducted within sixty (60) days after the initial receipt of the Notice of Dispute, it shall be incumbent upon either Party to instigate legal action for the resolution of such dispute, provided that a reasonable effort towards resolution through alternative means has first been exhausted.

original: 12.4 NO JURY TRIAL . THE PARTIES EXPRESSLY WAIVE AND FOREGO, TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, ANY RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY LEGAL PROCEEDING (WHETHER BASED ON CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE) DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, THE TRANSACTIONS CONTEMPLATED HEREBY OR THE ACTIONS OF THE PARTIES IN THE NEGOTIATION, ADMINISTRATION, PERFORMANCE OR ENFORCEMENT HEREOF.
modified: 12.4 OPTIONAL JURY TRIAL . At the mutual agreement of the Parties, and to the extent permitted by law, the right to a trial by jury may be exercised in any legal proceeding (whether based on contract, tort or otherwise) directly or indirectly arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the Transactions Contemplated Hereby or the Actions of the Parties in the Negotiation, Administration, Performance or Enforcement Hereof. If no such agreement is reached, the Parties shall waive and forego, to the fullest extent permitted by law, their right to a jury trial.

In this revised clause, I have slightly altered the original by making it clear that while other departments may receive a copy of correspondence related to the agreement, they will not be considered as having formally received any notice under the terms of the agreement.

original: Arnold & Porter Kaye Scholer LLP 250 West 55 th Street New York, NY 10019-9710 Attn: Lowell Dashefsky and Eric Rothman Email: lowell.dashefsky  @arnoldporter.com and eric.rothman@arnoldporter.com 13.4 No Strict Construction; Interpretation; Headings . The language in this Agreement is to be construed in all cases according to its fair meaning. Except where the context otherwise requires, wherever used, the singular includes the plural, the plural the singular, the use of any gender applies to all genders. The word “or” is used in the disjunctive sense and the word “and” is used in the conjunctive sense. The captions of this Agreement are for convenience of reference only and in no way define, describe, extend, or limit the scope or intent of this Agreement or the intent of any provision contained in this Agreement. The term “including,” “include,” or “includes”, whether or not followed by “without limitation” or “including, but not limited to,” or words of similar import, shall be construed to mean in each case including, without limiting the generality of any description preceding such term. The Parties agree that no meaning should be inferred about the use of “without limitation” or “including, but not limited to” in some instances but not others. Unless the context requires otherwise, (i) any definition of or reference to any agreement, instrument or other document will be construed as referring to such agreement, instrument or other document as from time to time amended, supplemented or otherwise modified (subject to any restrictions on such amendments, supplements or modifications set forth herein or therein), (ii) any reference to any Laws will be construed as referring to such Laws as from time to time enacted, repealed or amended, (iii) any reference to any Person will be construed to include the Person’s successors and permitted assigns, (iv) the words “herein”, “hereof” and “hereunder”, and words of similar import, will be construed to refer to this Agreement in its entirety and not to any particular provision hereof, (v) any reference to the words “mutually agree” or “mutual written agreement” will not impose any obligation on either Party to agree to any terms relating thereto or to engage in discussions relating to such terms except as such Party may determine in such Party’s sole discretion, (vi) all references to Sections, Exhibits or Schedules will be construed to refer to Sections, Exhibits and Schedules to this Agreement, (vii) the word “days” means calendar days and the word “month” means calendar month unless otherwise specified, (viii) the words “copy” and “copies” and words of similar import when used in this Agreement include, to the extent available, electronic copies, files or databases containing the information, files, items, documents or materials to which such words apply, and (ix) any reference “dollar”, “dollars” or “$” will be construed to refer to U.S. dollars. The headings of each Article and Section in this Agreement have been inserted for convenience of reference only and are not intended to limit or expand on the meaning of the language contained in the particular Article or Section. Each Party represents that it has been represented by legal counsel in connection with this Agreement and acknowledges that it has participated in the drafting hereof. In interpreting and applying the terms and provisions of this Agreement, the Parties agree that no presumption will apply against the Party which drafted such terms and provisions.
ollama_generated:
13.4 Flexible Interpretation and Construal; Headings

The words in this Agreement are to be understood in a reasonable manner in all circumstances, except where the context clearly necessitates otherwise. For clarity, singular terms encompass plural meanings, and vice versa. The term "or" denotes an inclusive meaning, while "and" signifies a conjunction. The headings used throughout this Agreement are for ease of reference only and do not serve to define, restrict, expand or alter the scope or intent of this Agreement or any of its provisions.

The phrase "including," "include," or "includes", whether preceded by "without limitation" or phrases of similar import, is intended to encompass all possibilities within the description provided, rather than limiting its scope. The parties agree that no inference regarding the use of "without limitation" or "including, but not limited to" should be made in certain instances over others.

Unless otherwise specified, any reference to an agreement, instrument, or other document refers to the current version thereof, as amended, supplemented, or modified (subject to any limitations on such modifications as provided herein or therein). Any reference to laws will encompass their subsequent amendments and repeals. Any reference to a person includes that individual's successors and permitted assignees.

The phrases "herein", "hereof" and "hereunder" refer to this Agreement as a whole, rather than any particular provision. The parties agree that the terms "mutually agree" or "mutual written agreement" do not impose an obligation on either party to engage in discussions regarding such terms unless the relevant party chooses to do so at its sole discretion.

References to Sections, Exhibits, or Schedules pertain exclusively to those within this Agreement. The term "days" means calendar days and "month" means calendar month, unless otherwise specified. Electronic copies, files, or databases containing the relevant information are included in the meaning of "copy" and "copies."

The phrase "dollar," "dollars," or "$" refers to U.S. dollars throughout this Agreement. The headings for each Article and Section have been inserted solely for convenience and do not serve to limit or expand upon the meaning of the text contained within them.

Each party confirms that it has been represented by legal counsel in relation to this Agreement and acknowledges its active participation in its drafting. When interpreting and applying the terms and provisions of this Agreement, the parties agree that no presumption will be made against the party responsible for drafting such terms or provisions.

original: SIGA has a legal and corporate responsibility to comply with applicable regulations governing the collection and reporting of adverse events (“ AE(s) ”), at risk scenarios (“ ARSs ”), unexpected therapeutic effects (“ UTEs ”), and product quality complaints (“ PQC(s) ”) associated with the Product, as these terms are defined below. For the purposes of this Exhibit, AEs, ARSs, UTEs, and PQCs are collectively termed “Safety Reports.” MMT is expressly entitled to perform any regulatory responsibilities for the Product through any of its Affiliates. MMT or an Affiliate of MMT shall exchange Safety Reports with the SIGA contact listed in section 4.1 Reporting Time-Frames . Throughout this Safety Reporting Exhibit, SIGA shall be referred to as “SIGA” and MMT and its Affiliates collectively as “Promoter.” At all times SIGA and Promoter shall follow the procedures set out below.
ollama_generated: The Promoter (MMT or any of its Affiliates) assumes the legal and corporate responsibility for complying with regulations pertaining to the collection and reporting of adverse events ("AE(s)"), at-risk scenarios ("ARSs"), unexpected therapeutic effects ("UTEs"), and product quality complaints ("PQC(s)") related to the Product, as defined in this agreement. For the sake of clarity within this Exhibit, AEs, ARSs, UTEs, and PQCs are collectively known as "Safety Reports." SIGA retains the option to fulfill any regulatory duties concerning the Product directly or through a third party. SIGA shall supply Safety Reports to the designated contact at Promoter, as outlined in section 4.1 Reporting Time-Frames, within the specified timeframes. In this Safety Reporting Exhibit, Promoter is referred to as "Promoter" and SIGA as "SIGA." At all times, both parties are expected to adhere to the procedures outlined below, with the understanding that the primary responsibility for regulatory compliance rests with the Promoter.

original: •Abnormal test findings •Clinically significant symptoms and signs Source: SIGA TECHNOLOGIES INC, 8-K, 6/3/2019 •Changes in physical examination findings •Hypersensitivity •Progression/worsening of underlying disease •Lack of drug efficacy •Drug abuse •Drug dependency •Signs and symptoms resulting from drug withdrawal and drug interactions •Suspected transmission of an infectious agent via a medicinal product 2.2. At risk scenarios (ARSs): circumstances where the report does not include an AE per se , but nevertheless needs to be reported to SIGA. These circumstances include:
ollama_generated:
2.2. Potentially Significant Scenarios (PSSs): instances where a report may not explicitly list an Adverse Event (AE), yet warrants communication to SIGA due to potential implications. Such instances encompass:

Adverse reactions, even if not directly classified as AEs, such as abnormal test findings or changes in physical examination results. Additionally, scenarios that suggest progression/improvement of an underlying disease, drug inefficacy, or the emergence of hypersensitivity should also be reported. Moreover, signs of drug abuse, dependency, withdrawal, or interactions necessitate reporting. Lastly, any suspected transmission of an infectious agent via a medicinal product should be communicated to SIGA without delay.

original: 3.1. Promoter shall ensure that all employees and, if applicable, subcontractor employees performing activities under this Agreement (“Promoter Personnel ”) who may become aware of a Safety Report associated with the use of the Product comply with the requirements set out in this Exhibit.
ollama_generated: 3.1. It is hereby understood that Users or their designated representatives, including but not limited to Promoter Personnel, shall have the discretion to report any safety concerns pertaining to the Product as outlined in this Exhibit ("Safety Reports"). However, should a Safety Report be submitted, the User shall assume responsibility for ensuring prompt and appropriate action is taken in accordance with the requirements set out in this Exhibit.

original: 3.2. If Promoter Personnel become aware of a Safety Report that may be associated with the Product, Promoter shall inform SIGA in accordance with the reporting procedures included in this Exhibit and as may be updated and provided to Promoter in the future by 3.3. In the event Promoter engages a subcontractor to perform services related to this Agreement, Promoter shall request fulfilment by that subcontractor of these safety reporting requirements on substantially the same terms as those outlined in this Exhibit, unless it is established that there is no possibility that the subcontracted services will involve receipt or handling of Safety Reports by the subcontractor.
ollama_generated:
3.2. If SIGA becomes aware of a Safety Report potentially linked to the Product, SIGA shall promptly notify Promoter in accordance with the reporting procedures outlined in this Exhibit and any subsequent updates provided. In cases where SIGA employs a subcontractor for services pertaining to this Agreement, SIGA shall endeavor to ensure that the subcontractor complies with these safety reporting requirements under comparable terms as detailed in this Exhibit, unless it can be demonstrated that the subcontracted services will not entail the subcontractor receiving or managing Safety Reports.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility of reporting Safety Reports from Promoter to SIGA and adds a condition for when SIGA should employ a subcontractor: only when it is evident that the subcontracted services will not require the subcontractor to handle Safety Reports.

original: Where possible, SIGA shall be informed prior to, and have the opportunity to review, any response to the regulatory authority by Promoter.
ollama_generated: Upon reasonable notice, Promoter shall extend an invitation to SIGA for consultation prior to submitting any response to a regulatory authority; however, SIGA's failure to respond within such notice period shall not impede Promoter's ability to comply with the regulatory requirements.

original: 4575 Research Way, Suite 110, Corvallis, OR 97333 4.2. Case Receipt Confirmation:  The receipt of Safety Reports from Promoter shall be acknowledged by SIGA in writing no later than one (1) Business Day following receipt. If acknowledgement of receipt is not received within this timeframe, then Promoter shall contact SIGA to determine if the source documents need to be re-sent.

4575 Research Way, Suite 110, Corvallis, OR 97333
4.2. Case Receipt Confirmation (Revised): In the event that Safety Reports are submitted by Promoter, SIGA shall make reasonable efforts to acknowledge receipt within one (1) Business Day following such submission. However, if SIGA fails to acknowledge receipt within this timeframe, it is not a breach of this Agreement and Promoter shall not be required to take any action unless specifically instructed otherwise by SIGA. In the event that Promoter does not receive an acknowledgement of receipt within a reasonable period, they may inquire about the status of their submission with SIGA for clarification purposes only.

original: In forwarding Safety Reports to SIGA, Promoter shall comply with all applicable privacy and data protection laws, rules and regulations on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of Personal Data and the free movement of such data. “Personal Data” means information that can be used by itself or in combination with other available information to identify a specific individual.  The Promoter shall collect, use and disclose any Personal Data obtained in the course of performing the safety related activities under this Agreement solely for the purposes of complying with the regulatory obligations as described in this Agreement, or as otherwise required by law or by a court order. Promoter shall use electronic, physical, and other safeguards appropriate to the nature of the information to prevent any use or disclosure of Personal Data other than as provided for by this Agreement. Promoter will also take reasonable precautions to protect the Personal Data from alteration or destruction.
ollama_generated:
In receipt of Safety Reports from Promoter, SIGA expects adherence to all relevant privacy and data protection statutes, ordinances, and guidelines concerning the management of Personal Data and its cross-border transfer. "Personal Data" refers to details that, when isolated or combined with other accessible information, have the potential to identify a unique individual.

SIGA reserves the right to utilize, disclose, and process any obtained Personal Data exclusively for regulatory obligations as outlined in this Agreement, legal requirements, or court orders. SIGA assures the implementation of adequate electronic, physical, and other safeguards proportionate to the nature and sensitivity of the data, to prevent unauthorized access, use, or disclosure of Personal Data beyond the scope of this Agreement.

SIGA further guarantees reasonable measures to protect the integrity and continuity of the Personal Data from modification, loss, or destruction.
